results.title: Bim (K)
results.creator_credit: L'Ecran des Jeunes, Georges Derocles and Albert Lamorisse
results.brief_description: Bim is the first achievement of director, Albert Lamorisse and, as in the case of Crin Blanc and his latest release ‘The Red Balloon’, he has made a delightful film. Photographed in Algiers, it tells of the adventures of a donkey and his youthful, affectionate owner. Lamorisse is one of those film makers who have a camera eye, that is the gift of pointing the camera lens to obtain pictures of infinite expressiveness. The most distinguished director in this field is Robert Flaherty. The story is that long ago in a far off Eastern Island, it was the custom for each child to have a baby donkey as a pet. One day the son of the Prince was riding haughtily through the streets when he took a fancy to Bim, the donkey belonging to a poor boy called Abdallah. The guards kidnapped Bim, who found himself a prisoner, condemned to death for eating the Great Prince’s dinner, Bim was rescued by thieves who raided the island for animals. After a thrilling chase on land and sea, Abdallah and his friends managed to rescue Bim and all ended happily. Narrated by William Bledsoe.

results.title: Biloxi blues
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Ray Stark and Mike Nichols
results.brief_description: The year is 1943 and Eugene Morris Jerome, (Matthew Broderick), finds himself far from the comforts of his Brooklyn home when he is drafted and sent to basic training in Mississippi. Expecting to find donuts and USO dances, he instead encounters a weird and sadistic drill sergeant, (Christopher Walken), and a platoon of often hostile recruits. Armed only with his sense of humour and a quick wit, Eugene is determined to survive the rigours of army life and leave the camp with everything he came with… except his virginity. Directed by Mike Nichols, Neil Simon’s hilarious adaptation of his long-running Broadway comedy is the story of Eugene’s comical travels from adolescence to adulthood.

results.title: Billy Madison
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Robert Simonds and Tamara Davis
results.brief_description: Billy Madison’s future is made, or so he thought. He is heir to his father’s fortune, he’s passed high school compliments of his father’s cheque book, and he spends his days lazing by the pool, drinking and chasing women. His world is thrown into chaos when his father informs him of plans to hand over the family fortune, the Fortune 500 company, to vice president, and resident weasel, Eric Gordon. Billy makes a bet with his father to regain what is rightfully his. The bet is that Billy will go back to school and pass every year level within 24 weeks. Working against him is Eric, determined to retain the company, while working for him is an attractive teacher whose very interested in her new student. Cast includes Adam Sandler, Bradley Whitford, Darren McGavin and Bridgette Wilson.

results.title: Billy Liar
results.creator_credit: Vic Films, Waterhall Productions, Joseph Janni and John Schlesinger
results.brief_description: Billy Fisher lives in the rich and escapist world of his wild imagination. An irresponsible clerk in a north country town, Billy is unable to tell the truth even for two minutes. In his fantasies, Billy is a successful man of the world; in reality he gets into one scrape after another. Unable to communicate with his parents, engaged to two girls at the same time and dreaming of being a writer, Billy’s life becomes almost unbearable. Into this picture enters Liz. Her free spirit and appreciation of the creativity behind the day-dreams, offers Billy the possibility of escape. Tom Courtenay is Billy and Julie Christie is Liz in what is recognised as one of the landmark films of its decade.

results.title: Billy Elliot [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Tiger Aspect Pictures, Greg Brenman, Jon Finn and Stephen Daldry
results.brief_description: Growing up in a small town in Northern England, crippled by strikes, Billy Elliot (Jamie Bell) tries to discover his place in the world. His mother dead, a brother and father on the picket line, Billy fills his days with tending to his grandmother and hanging out with his crossing-dressing friend. However, Billy wants more and he finds his calling when one day he decides to join in on a ballet class. Seeing that Billy has a natural talent the Ballet Teacher ( Julie Walters ) suggests to him that he try out for a the Royal Ballet School in London. The pair train in preparation but all is nearly lost when Billy’s father and brother find out about his passion for ballet. Billy Elliot is a touching story that explores the confines of masculinity within the back drop of the 1980’s violent struggle between the unions and the Thatcher government.

results.title: Billy's Hollywood screen kiss
results.creator_credit: Revolutionary Eye, David Moseley and Tommy O'Haver
results.brief_description: Tommy O’Haver’s upbeat romantic comedy is an affectionate tribute to gay men’s affiliation and love affair with the movies and the larger than life screen passions which subsequently inform and delude romantic expectations. Aspiring photographer Billy Coller (Sean. P Hayes) is down on his luck financially and romantically. His unfortunate habit of falling for straight guys lands heterosexual model Gabriel (Brad Rowe) into his path. When Billy enlists his new found lust object into posing for a series of queer themed photos aping classic screen kisses, sexual confusion ensues. Cast includes Paul Bartel, Holly Woodlawn, Richard Ganoung and Meredith Scott Lynn.

results.title: Billy's holiday
results.creator_credit: Billy's Holiday Pty Ltd, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Tristram Miall, Denis Whitburn and Richard Wherrett
results.brief_description: Appleby Hardware store and its owner, Billy Apples (Max Cullen), are the unlikely candidates for becoming the newest singing sensation. Billy doesn’t have alot going for him; a wife that left him, a so-so business, a rather unsuccessful band that performs at the local watering hole (mainly because Billy is a rotten singer) and a daughter who disowns him. One night Billy witnesses a comet shower and his life changes when he discovers he can sing like Billie Holiday: overnight, Billy Apples becomes a celebrity. Fame renews the affections of his wife, but it also distances him from family and friends, leading Billy to question his new existence. Also starring Kris McQuade, Tina Bursill, Drew Forsythe, Genevieve Lemon, Rachael Coopes and Richard Roxburgh.

results.title: Billy's helicopter ride
results.brief_description: Introduces the helicopter and its uses through the story of a young boy taking his first ride. Gives children an opportunity to experience second-hand what they might never experience themselves.

results.title: Billion dollar bubble: the true story of the biggest fraud of all time (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Horizon (GB), Horizon Films (AU) and Brian Gibson
results.brief_description: A re-enactment of one of the biggest frauds of all time. In 1969, the Equity Funding Corporation of America lacked the facts to make an accurate profit forecast because of computer troubles. They made a guess - two million dollars too optimistic. So two young executives fed fictitious insurance polices in the computer - all prefixed “99” so that they could easily be cancelled when the temporary loan was paid off. But the temptation to escalate the fraud became irresistible. Cast includes James Woods, Bill Hootkins, Shane Rimmer, Sam Wanamaker, Christopher Guest and Lionel Murton. Script by Tom Clarke.

results.title: Billie in Oakleigh
results.brief_description:
A short home-movie shot in slow-motion of the graceful and elegant movements of Billie O’Keefe as she performs a gymnastic routine in the urban landscape of Oxford Street, Oakleigh.
This poetic film is backed by the haunting soundtrack of celtic music played by Cath Connelly (harp) and Greg Hunt (fiddle).
